alert.note: Alert for Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 4:08PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Snow Above 3000 Feet After Midnight Tonight... Snow levels will drop to 2000-3000 ft across the Interior, Brooks Range and Alaska Range after midnight tonight. Little if any snow will accumulate below 3000 ft, while an inch or two of snow will accumulate by Saturday morning in areas above 3000 ft. Areas in the Alaska Range above 4000 ft could see 4-6 inches of snow by Saturday morning. A strong Arctic cold front now over the West Coast of Alaska will move east across the Interior late tonight and Saturday. This will bring much cooler temperatures along with the lower snow levels to the Interior, Alaska Range and Brooks Range after midnight tonight. Winds and rain across the Interior will diminish Saturday afternoon and evening as high pressure builds over the Eastern Interior. Below freezing temperatures are expected near the ALCAN Border Saturday night. In Fairbanks clouds are expected to move in late Saturday night to keep temperatures above freezing. The Alaska Range could also see rock and mud slides through tonight as more rain falls on saturated soils.

area.areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands
